page.title: 05The Stornoway Trust.
page.content: In 1923,Lord Leverhulme,the then owner of the island 0f Lewis,gifted the land of the parish of Stornoway to the local people. Resulting from this,the Stornoway Trust was constituted. Ten men are elected from the community to serve on a board of Trustees for a period of 5 years. These men form the governing body of the parish and they appoint a factor with assistants, to carry out the duties of the estate. The Trustees meet once a month to deal with estate business e.g.fixing rents, granting peat permits and land feus etc. The Trust is a registered charity and as such,distributes financial assistance to various local organisations.
